description.default: Returns true if the value of FIELD is blank according to the definition for FIELD in an upstream type node.
Converts ITEM to an integer. ITEM must be a string, or a number default.
Returns the number of values from a LIST of fields that are equal to ITEM1, or NULL if ITEM1 is NULL.
Returns true if the value of FIELD is blank according to the definition for FIELD in an upstream type node.
Returns the first differential of FIELD1 or the first differential of FIELD1 with respect to FIELD2.
Returns the date value for the given YEAR, MONTH, and DAY. The arguments must be integers.
Returns the time value for the specified HOUR, MINUTE, and SECOND. The arguments must be integers.
Returns the timestamp value for the given YEAR, MONTH, DAY, HOUR, MINUTE, and SECOND.
Add two numbers. X + Y.
X to the power of Y. X ** Y.
Subtract two numbers. X - Y.
Quotient of dividing two numbers. X div Y.

Expression is not true.  not(Expr).
Concatenate two strings. String1 >< String2.
Used between two integers. The result is the bitwise 'and' of INT1 and the bitwise complement of INT2.
Used in between two CLEM expressions. Returns a value of true if both EXPR1 and EXPR2 are true.
Used in between two CLEM expressions. Returns a value of true if either EXPR1 or EXPR2 is true, or if both are true.
Returns a value of true if COND is false. Otherwise, returns a value of 0.
If COND is true, returns the result of evaluating EXPR1. Otherwise, returns the result of evaluating EXPR2.

description.default: If COND1 is true, returns the result of EXPR1. If COND2 is true, the result of EXPR2. Otherwise, EXPRN.
Used between any two comparable items. Returns true if ITEM1 is equal to ITEM2.
Used between any two comparable items. Returns true if ITEM1 is NOT equal to ITEM2.
Used between any two comparable items. Returns true if ITEM1 is strictly less than ITEM2.
Used between any two comparable items. Returns true if ITEM1 is less than or equal to ITEM2.
Used between any two comparable items. Returns true if ITEM1 is strictly greater than ITEM2.
Used between any two comparable items. Returns true if ITEM1 is greater than or equal to ITEM2.
Used between two numbers: NUM1 - NUM2 (subtracts NUM2 from NUM1) or in front of a number: - NUM.
Used between two numbers: NUM1 + NUM2. Adds NUM1 to NUM2.
Used between two numbers: NUM1 * NUM2. Multiplies NUM1 by NUM2.
Used between two numbers: NUM1 / NUM2. Divides NUM1 by NUM2.
Used between two integers: INT1 div INT2. Performs integer division.
Used between two integers: INT1 mod INT2. Returns INT1 modulo INT2.
Used between two integers: INT1 rem INT2. Returns the remainder, INT1 - (INT1 div INT2) * INT2.
Used between two numbers: BASE ** POWER. Returns BASE raised to the power POWER.
Used in front of an integer. Produces the bitwise complement of INT.
Used between two integers. The result is the bitwise 'inclusive or' of INT1 and INT2.
Used between two integers. The result is the bitwise 'exclusive or' of INT1 and INT2.
Used between two integers. The result is the bitwise 'and' of the integers INT1 and INT2.
Used between two integers. The result is the bitwise 'and' of INT1 and the bitwise complement of INT2.
Used between two integers. Produces the bit pattern of INT shifted left by N positions.
Used between two integers. Produces the bit pattern of INT shifted right by N positions.
Used between two integers. Equivalent to the boolean expression INT1 && INT2 = 0.
Used between two integers. Equivalent to the boolean expression INT1 && INT2 /= 0.
Used between two strings. Concatenates all of the characters of STRING1with all of the characters of STRING2.
Returns a value of true if STRING1 matches the pattern defined by STRING2. "?" matches 1 character, "*" matches 0 or more characters, and "\" escapes these characters.
